main event: An airline pilot reported an unidentified object on his path from Amarillo to El Paso, Texas, in 1957. The object was observed on ground radar, traveling at a high speed and making a sudden acceleration before disappearing.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 50 to 75 feet in diameter by the pilot.
The pilot estimated the object's speed to be 3,000 mph, and the authorities denied the pilot's request to chase the object.
The document emphasizes the official nature of the Air Force report and the pilot's reliability and qualifications.
The report mentions another incident where a TWA airliner almost collided with a UFO at 18,000 ft altitude on the route from Chicago to Tucson.
It is suggested that the investigation of unidentified aerial phenomena be conducted with confidentiality and not intended for public discussion at that time, except through regular channels.
